Yes, there have been many contemporary theatre productions where the costumes have been noteworthy. Here are a few:

1. Hamilton: The costume designer, Paul Tazewell, won a Tony Award for his work on this production. He created modern and edgy costumes that blended contemporary fashion with historical references. The costumes helped to create a fresh and unique interpretation of the story.

2. Moulin Rouge!: Costume designer Catherine Zuber created extravagant, colorful, and extravagant costumes that perfectly captured the excess and glamour of the Moulin Rouge cabaret life. The costumes were an important part of the visual spectacle of the production.

3. The Lion King: The costume designs for this production were created by Julie Taymor, who used innovative puppetry and mask work to bring the animals to life. The stunning costume designs are an essential element of the show's visual language.

4. Hadestown: Costume designer Michael Krass created costumes that blended historical, modern and fantasy elements to tell the story of the show. The costumes were designed to reflect the themes of the production, and brought the world of the underworld to life.

Overall, costume designers play an essential role in contemporary theatre productions, and their work can have a significant impact on the overall success of the production.
